page.title: 13PASKELLS WOODYARD, NICOLE B
page.content: PASKELLS HAS JUST BEEN TAKEN OVER BY A NEW FIRM CALLED ANGLIAN TIMBER.ALREADY THEY ARE EMPLOYING MORE MEN,ABOUT 18. THE WORK OF THE YARD IS DIVIDED INTO 4 PARTS.LOGS OF WOOD SUCH AS OAK,ELM, LARCH,DOUGLAS FIR AND CORSICAN PINE ARRIVE AT THE YARD AND ARE CUT UP BY BAND AND CROSS_CUT SAWS.SOME TIMBER ARRIVES FROM SWEDEN, FINLAND AND CANADA ALREADY CUT UP.SOME TIMBER IS SOLD TO BUILDERS AND JOINERS TO MAKE ROOFS,WINDOWS,DOORS AND FLOORS.OTHER TIMBER IS USED FOR MAKING CRATES, FENCING AND FOR SEA DEFENCE WORK ANOTHER PART OF THE FIRM STILL DEALS WITH FUNERALS AND ANOTHER LITTLE SHOP WILL BE OPEN SOON TO SELL SMALL AMOUNTS OF HARDWOODS TO LOCAL PEOPLE.EXPENSIVE WOOD IS STORED IN LARGE SHEDS AT THE YARD.TREATED WOOD CAN BE STORED OUTSIDE FOR A FEW WEEKS.
